title: Varadkar pledges to be Athena to Johnson's Hercules in apparent classical dig – video
text:
The Irish prime minister, Leo Varadkar, appeared to tease Boris Johnson at their joint press conference in Dublin with a passing classical reference.

'Negotiating FTAs [free trade agreements] with the EU and US … is going to be a herculean task for you,' Varadkar told Johnson, who studied classics as a student. 'We want to be your friend and ally, your Athena, in doing so.'

In Greek mythology, Athena dramatically intervened after Hercules went mad and killed his wife and children, knocking him out to prevent further bloodshed.

While Johnson smiled at the reference, it is unclear whether he had understood the implications of the taoiseach's words
description: The Irish prime minister, Leo Varadkar, appeared to tease Boris Johnson at their joint press conference in Dublin with a passing classical remark
